p: A total of 238 of the 414 (57.5%) specimens collected from these outbreaks were positive for NoV by real-time RT-PCR. GII was the main genogroup (204/238, 85.7%) identified, followed by GI (24/238, 10.1%), dual infection with GI+GII (9/238, 3.8%) and dual infection with GII+RoV-A (1/238, 0.4%). Of the 15 outbreaks, eight were caused by GII, five were caused by mixed infections with GI and GII and one was caused by mixed infections with GII and RoV-A. Outbreak XI was later confirmed as a bacterial infection ( Fig 1). All 414 specimens were negative for SaV, Ast and ADV.
